text: Thomas Francis ReillyBoston College Bulletin, Law, 1971 (born February 14, 1942) is an American lawyer and politician. He was the 45th Massachusetts Attorney General from 1999 to 2007. He was born in Springfield, Massachusetts. He was one of three candidates who ran for the Democratic nomination for governor of Massachusetts in 2006, losing to Deval Patrick. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:Massachusetts attorneys general Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:People from Springfield, Massachusetts
title: Thomas Reilly
